statements: SELECT * FROM RestaurantReviews;
SELECT review_id, city, rating FROM RestaurantReviews WHERE rating > 4.5;
SELECT user_id, restaurant_id, city FROM RestaurantReviews WHERE city = 'New York';
SELECT * FROM RestaurantReviews ORDER BY rating DESC;
SELECT AVG(rating) as avg_rating, city FROM RestaurantReviews GROUP BY city;
SELECT * FROM RestaurantReviews WHERE rating > 4.0 ORDER BY restaurant_id DESC;
SELECT user_id, city, COUNT(review_id) AS num_reviews FROM RestaurantReviews GROUP BY user_id, city;
SELECT restaurant_id, AVG(rating) AS avg_rating FROM RestaurantReviews WHERE city = 'New York' GROUP BY restaurant_id HAVING avg_rating > 3.5;
SELECT review_id, review_text FROM RestaurantReviews WHERE city = 'San Francisco' AND rating BETWEEN 3.0 AND 4.0;
SELECT user_id, COUNT(DISTINCT city) AS num_cities_reviewed FROM RestaurantReviews GROUP BY user_id HAVING num_cities_reviewed > 1 ORDER BY user_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM restaurant_reviews WHERE city = 'New York'
SELECT review_id, user_id, rating FROM restaurant_reviews WHERE restaurant_id = 100
SELECT restaurant_name, cuisine_type FROM restaurants WHERE city = 'Paris'
SELECT * FROM restaurant_reviews ORDER BY rating DESC
SELECT user_id, city, rating FROM restaurant_reviews WHERE city = 'London' ORDER BY user_id ASC
SELECT * FROM restaurant_reviews WHERE city='New York' ORDER BY rating DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT restaurant_name, city, cuisine_type FROM restaurants WHERE city='London' ORDER BY restaurant_name ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT user_id, city FROM restaurant_reviews WHERE rating > 4.5 AND city='Paris';
SELECT avg(rating) AS avg_rating, city FROM restaurant_reviews GROUP BY city HAVING avg(rating) > 3.0;
SELECT * FROM restaurant_reviews r JOIN restaurants res ON r.restaurant_id = res.restaurant_id WHERE r.city = res.city ORDER BY r.rating DESC;
SELECT * FROM restaurants ORDER BY name DESC
SELECT id, name FROM restaurants WHERE city='New York'
SELECT * FROM reviews WHERE rating > 3
SELECT id, name, city FROM restaurants WHERE id = 1
SELECT r.id, r.name, c.name AS city_name FROM restaurants r JOIN cities c ON r.city = c.id
SELECT * FROM restaurants WHERE city='New York' ORDER BY name ASC LIMIT 5
SELECT name, rating FROM restaurants JOIN reviews ON restaurants.id = reviews.restaurant_id WHERE rating >= 4 ORDER BY rating DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT cities.name, COUNT(restaurants.id) AS total_restaurants FROM cities LEFT JOIN restaurants ON cities.id = restaurants.id GROUP BY cities.name ORDER BY total_restaurants DESC
SELECT DISTINCT restaurants.city FROM restaurants JOIN reviews ON restaurants.id = reviews.restaurant_id WHERE rating < 3
SELECT r.name, AVG(rating) AS avg_rating FROM restaurants r JOIN reviews ON r.id = reviews.restaurant_id GROUP BY r.name HAVING avg_rating > 3 ORDER BY avg_rating DESC
SELECT name FROM Restaurant;
SELECT * FROM Review WHERE rating > 3;
SELECT * FROM User WHERE username = 'john_doe';
SELECT * FROM Restaurant ORDER BY city DESC;
SELECT name, city FROM Restaurant JOIN City ON Restaurant.city = City.name;
SELECT * FROM Restaurant JOIN Review ON Restaurant.id = Review.restaurant_id;
SELECT name, city FROM Restaurant WHERE city = 'New York';
SELECT r.name, COUNT(re.rating) FROM Restaurant r JOIN Review re ON r.id = re.restaurant_id GROUP BY r.name;
SELECT u.username, r.name, re.rating, re.comment FROM User u JOIN Review re ON u.id = re.user_id JOIN Restaurant r ON re.restaurant_id = r.id;
SELECT city, COUNT(name) FROM Restaurant GROUP BY city ORDER BY COUNT(name) DESC;
SELECT * FROM restaurant LIMIT 5
SELECT name, city FROM restaurant WHERE rating > 4.0
SELECT restaurant.name, city.name FROM restaurant INNER JOIN city ON restaurant.city = city.id
SELECT * FROM review ORDER BY rating DESC, id ASC
SELECT restaurant.name, restaurant.rating, city.name FROM restaurant INNER JOIN city ON restaurant.city = city.id WHERE city.country = 'USA'
SELECT * FROM restaurant WHERE city = 'New York' ORDER BY rating DESC
SELECT id, name, rating FROM restaurant WHERE city = 'Los Angeles' AND rating > 4.5 ORDER BY name ASC
SELECT r.name, c.name as city_name, r.rating FROM restaurant r JOIN city c ON r.city = c.id WHERE r.rating < 4 ORDER BY c.name, r.rating DESC
SELECT * FROM restaurant JOIN review ON restaurant.id = review.restaurant_id WHERE review.rating > 3 AND review.comment IS NOT NULL

SELECT u.username, r.name as restaurant_name, rv.rating FROM user u JOIN review rv ON u.id = rv.user_id JOIN restaurant r ON rv.restaurant_id = r.id WHERE u.email LIKE '%@example.com%' ORDER BY rv.rating DESC
